title: American researcher stuck deep in a Turkish cave is rescued after falling ill
description: Mark Dickey, who was on an expedition to map the country's third deepest cave, became seriously ill more than a week ago. Rescuers retrieved him from nearly 1,000 meters below the cave's entrance.

title: What we know about Kim Jong Un's train — a slow-moving bulletproof fortress
description: On Monday, a dark green train with yellow trim was spotted at the border where Russia, China and North Korea meet. It runs with one passenger in mind: the leader of North Korea, Kim Jong Un.

title: How to see a newly-discovered green comet this week, before it vanishes for 400 years
description: A newly-discovered green comet is zipping by Earth and is now visible for the first time since before Galileo invented his telescope.

title: 'Star Wars' Red Leader X-wing model heads a cargo bay's worth of props at auction
description: More than 550 items from the late Greg Jein are heading to auction, from Nichelle Nichols' iconic knee-high boots and red tunic as Lt. Uhura to a hairpiece for William Shatner's Captain Kirk.

title: Drew Barrymore to restart her talk show amid strikes, drawing heated criticism
description: Drew Barrymore has announced she is bringing back her talk show amid the ongoing Hollywood strikes, sparking condemnation among fellow actors and calls for the show to be picketed.

title: Latest on Ukraine: Kim Jong Un to meet with Putin; G20 statement; Blinken visits Kyiv
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Twinkies are sold! J.M. Smucker scoops up Hostess Brands for $5.6 billion
description: For Hostess, the deal with the peanut-butter-and-jelly conglomerate is a sweet win after not one, but two bankruptcies.

title: The Kremlin confirms Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will meet this week
description: U.S. officials announced last week that the two leaders would meet in Vladivostok, as Russian President Putin seeks more arms to supply his war in Ukraine. Russia confirmed the summit on Monday.

title: Up First briefing: Morocco earthquake; new COVID boosters; a primer on prenups
description: More than 2,000 are dead after a 6.8 magnitude quake struck near Marrakech on Friday. The FDA could approve new COVID boosters any day now. What to know if you're considering signing a prenup.

title: Chipping away at the 'epidemic of loneliness,' one new friendship at a time
description: A growing body of research shows loneliness has profound implications for physical and mental health. Some organizations in Massachusetts are trying to help people connect to lessen those affects.

title: Medical debt nearly pushed this family into homelessness. Millions more are at risk
description: Saddled with debt from health care, many Americans are forced into painful tradeoffs.  And some are losing their homes.

title: Why autoworkers' leader is calling for a 4-day work week from Big 3 car makers
description: Shawn Fain, the president of the UAW, is calling for a 32-hour work week at 40 hours of pay for autoworkers, an idea that was first embraced by the union's leaders almost a century ago.

title: Dozens die from a drone attack on an open market in Sudan as rival troops battle
description: More than 55 others were wounded in the attack in Khartoum's May neighborhood, where paramilitary forces battling the military were heavily deployed, the Sudan Doctors' Union said in a statement.

title: Michigan State suspends coach Mel Tucker after sexual harassment allegations
description: Michigan State suspended football coach Mel Tucker without pay after allegations in a report that he sexually harassed activist and rape survivor Brenda Tracy during a phone call last year.

title: Novak Djokovic wins the U.S. Open, taking his 24th Grand Slam title
description: Djokovic, a 36-year-old from Serbia, moved one major singles title in front of Serena Williams to become the first player to win 24 in the Open era, which began in 1968.
